channel.title: Make hiscores?
channel.description: How can I make good hiscores? I don't want to integrate with forums, just a completely new site, like how RuneScape has their own hiscores... Help.

item.title: Make hiscores?
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

you only add truth to my advice, you do not have to use php but you have to use some sort of server side scripting, if you cannot be assed enough to do so. simply buy it. nothing in life is free please don’t come to a development forum with no intention of learning something. its not being mean its just common sense. Also you did not try my original advice of the PHP Resource Index, its a great site please look it up and look at it i see numerous results for php sql tutorials.

Quit the bitching please.

You can always go to mscp if you want a C+P method.

Read full topic

item.title: Make hiscores?
item.dc:creator: @Cald_Panda Cald Panda
item.description:
@Cald_Panda wrote:

[quote=“filth scape, post:1, topic:230812”]How can I make good hiscores? I don’t want to integrate with forums, just a completely new site, like how RuneScape has their own hiscores… Help.[/quote]Try this:

<?php header("Location: http://www.moparisthebest.com"); ?>

Read full topic

item.title: Make hiscores?
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

Learn PHP and SQL. In the long run, if you actually build the highscores from the ground up, you’ll have enough experience from just this one little project to build a wide variety of applications. It’s not complex to write PHP code, and it’s meant to be user-friendly. Plus, if your website runs off of PHP and there’s an error that occurs at any given time, you don’t have to run off asking for help, you can easily fix it yourself, depending on how much experience you have with the language. Or you could buy it, as Silabsoft suggested.

Read full topic

item.title: Make hiscores?

item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:2, topic:230812”]Step 1: Grow up.
Step 2: Learn a few basics about your favorite web language. Although I personally hate the syntax, PHP is one of the favorite.
Step 3: Try using google you may find resources such as (the php resource index)
Step 4: If you are still helpless hire someone that knows what the fuck they are doing.[/quote]
yes ^

Step 2: Learn a few basics about your favorite web language. Although I personally hate the syntax, PHP is one of the favorite.
